quest.name: A Gazebo to Call Our Own
journal: Cyr may be the only man who has yet to drink from the well of madness.

Inspector's Log:
What strange twists and turns fate takes! For I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, now find myself father to Gigi, the lovable scamp who has yet to regain his missing memories. Regretfully, we have made no substantial progress of late on this front─nor have we gained any greater understanding of the miraculous power Gigi demonstrated in the markets, when he restored a priceless vase to pristine condition mere moments after it had shattered to pieces on the cobbles. Yet I remain confident that the answers to these many mysteries will be ours ere long, and my beloved boy will be granted the peace of mind he so rightfully deserves.
　　　　　　　　　　　　*　*　*
For a mercy, Cyr has finally been charged with a duty which does not directly concern Inspector Hildibrand and his heretical mammet Gigi. In recent days there have been rumors that the missing (and presumed dead by some) knights of the Heavens' Ward have been sighted in Ishgard, and while the inquisitor knows little of the circumstances, he nevertheless suspects heresy most foul. A thorough investigation is therefore in order─and Cyr would enlist not only your help, but that of the itinerant individuals currently taking shelter in a certain gazebo...

You find Inspector Hildibrand in the midst of lecturing his newly adopted son on the principles of gentlemanliness as they pertain to graffiti. Having come to view the Fortemps Manor gazebo as their home, the little mammet wished to decorate it with a drawing of their family crest. Alas, the life of a traveling inspector demands that Hildibrand forsake such luxuries as gazebos, if only for lack of financial means. Cyr then proceeds to tell the inspector of the incidents involving charlatans masquerading as knights of the Heavens' Ward, and the innocent maidens taken in by their dastardly schemes─and the due compensation he will receive should he choose to assist the inquisition with its investigation. Inspector Hildibrand enthusiastically agrees to cooperate and soon after departs for the Last Vigil, all the faster for the unexpected appearance of his dear mother Julyan, who it seems would like nothing more than to return to Ul'dah with her beloved, if misguided son.

In questioning the maidens of the Last Vigil, you gain a greater understanding of the methods employed by the impersonators─as well as the deep and abiding devotion the young women have for the honored sers. Wisely electing not to disabuse them of any hopes they may harbor for their homecoming, you rejoin the others to share your findings.

The investigation appears to have reached a standstill until Inspector Hildibrand approaches another maiden at random. Though she turns out to be rather more elderly than the other victims, she too appears to have fallen prey to the impersonators' schemes. According to her account, the men were overheard discussing seeking shelter in distant Idyllshire. And so, just like that, your next destination is decided.

After an exceedingly eventful journey in which the party narrowly escapes death at the hands of the Dravanians, the Gnath, and the Illuminati, you arrive safely in Idyllshire. Never one to stop and catch his breath, Hildibrand immediately sets about questioning the residents of the eclectic community, and bids the others follow suit. If the oddly dressed crone is to be believed, then someone must surely know of the men you seek.

In a surprising and not at all suspicious turn of events, you and Cyr receive rather detailed information regarding the Grand Sers─the impostors you seek─from an elderly treasure hunter who bears a striking resemblance to the woman with whom you spoke in Ishgard. Upon hearing Cyr make note of this fact, the treasure hunter abruptly declares that a three-headed goobbue is behind you and flees. In any event, regardless of the questionable circumstances, Inspector Hildibrand should be pleased to learn of your findings.

As you gather outside the purported residence of the Grand Sers, Slowfix appears and greets Hildibrand as an old friend. It would seem that the goblin was the inspector's very first client, and that the experience gave him a newfound appreciation for the uplanders of Eorzea, planting the seed for the idea that would eventually become Idyllshire. To wit, Hildibrand could be considered by some to be a founding father of the aspiring utopia. In recognition of his contribution, Slowfix declares that the inspector may live in the building once leased to the Grand Sers, who are in arrears and have not been seen in some time. Overjoyed with this sudden windfall, Gigi begs his father for permission to draw their family crest on their new gazebo, and Hildibrand duly agrees, both to celebrate this joyous occasion and in the hopes that the brazen act might attract the attention of the missing Grand Sers. The mammet is given free rein to indulge his artistic sensibilities, and when he has finished, you wait...and continue to wait...and wait some more...
objectives: Speak with Hildibrand outside Fortemps Manor.
Question the maidens of the Last Vigil.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: That you stand here before me is proof that Halone smiles upon me this day. I have need of your assistance, Forename─and before you think to run away screaming in terror, I pray you hear me out.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: It concerns the esteemed─and now missing and presumed dead─knights of the Heavens' Ward. None have returned to the capital since all the...unpleasantness began, yet recently we have heard rumors of these honored sers walking the streets!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: 'Tis heresy most foul, I say, and I mean to get to the bottom of it! But we will need all the help that we can get, which means...Fury take me...we could benefit from a certain individual's...serendipity.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Besides, if we don't seek him out, he's like to show up at the worst possible time anyway. At least this way it'll be on our terms─and we can keep an eye on that boy─mammet! Mammet!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Yes, right... Oh, you must be wondering why I asked you to come. Well, you and the inspector seem to enjoy a natural rapport, so...

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Praise Halone, for a moment I was afraid you'd make me beg. This may well be my last chance to prove my worth to my superiors, and if I can't... Ahem. To Fortemps Manor!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: BuT wHy, PaPa HiLdY?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Little Gigi's been a very naughty girl.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...Because, Gigi, such behavior is unbecoming a gentleman!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: BuT wHy, PaPa HiLdY? wHy Is It UnBeCoMiNg A gEnTlEmAn?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah! Inquisitor Cyr, Forename! Good eveningmorrowday to you both. Are you come as adoring fans or on business?

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: ...Business. Always business, you may rest assured.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Then I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, am at your service! Is it robbery? Murder? Tax avoision!?

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Avoision? I─ Wait, before we get into that, what's going on here?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Much as it pains me to admit it, my beloved Gigi─the apple of my eye, the fruit of my loins─attempted to deface this lovely gazebo! Naturally, as his father, it falls to me to see him returned to the strait and narrow.

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: ThAt's NoT tRuE! i WaS dRaWiNg A fAmIlY cReSt FoR oUr HoMe!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now Gigi, I know you are fond of this gazebo, as are we all, but it belongs to Lord Edmont. You wouldn't want to steal from Uncle Edmont, would you?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: I...i GuEsS nOt. ThEn WhErE iS oUr GaZeBo, PaPa HiLdY? aNd DoEs It HaVe A wArM sToVe WiTh A sTeAmInG kEtTlE tOo?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oh Gigi, don't you see? We have no need of kettles or gazebos! As gentleman inspectors, the world is our oyster! We can go whither we please─where the red fern grows or the wild rose blooms!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: And yet you've been sleeping in Lord Edmont's gazebo for how long...?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: I dOn'T cArE aBoUt WiLd RoSeS! i WaNt To LiVe In A gAzEbO wItH pApA hIlDy AnD mAmA nAsHu!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Gazebos are quite expensive─and dangerous if not domesticated!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Dangerous indeed, my boy! And besides, we are gentleman inspectors free to travel the length and breadth of Eorzea in search of a case! Does that not sound more thrilling than whittling away the hours beneath a gazebo?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: I gUeSs...

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: If it's a case you want, you need not go so far. We are currently investigating reports of individuals masquerading as knights of the Heavens' Ward.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: These contemptible charlatans are rumored to have tricked several hapless maidens into attending private parties for a small fee, with the promise of enjoying the company of these great sers.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Those who were foolish enough to attend found their experiences to be so traumatizing that they have refused to discuss them in detail. Needless to say, your assistance in this matter would be greatly appreciated─and for it you shall receive due compensation.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Say no more, Inquisitor, say no more! I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, am well versed in the ways of the fairer sex.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Since when!?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Mummy! Ahem─Mother dearest! I was under the impression you had departed for Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: And leave my beloved boy to keep on playin' at bein' an inspector, as well as a father to a bloody mammet!? Bugger that. Yer comin' home right this instant!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: How can you say such things!? It is my life's calling to be an inspector. And Gigi is my son! He is a Manderville man!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: GrAnD─

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Grand as it is to see you, you have come at a most inopportune time. The young women of Ishgard are in need of a champion to defend them from fiends most foul!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Come, Nashu! Come, Gigi! We shall demonstrate to my mother our peerless investigative skills and bring these criminals to justice!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Thal's balls, he's stubborn. Probably gets it from his sorry arse of a father.

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: I trust you lot'll help me to keep him out of trouble? Right, then. Come along.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Well...that could've gone better. And worse. Let's not keep them waiting...

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: I can say one thing with absolute confidence: they're all quite mad.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: If the knights aren't supposed to, you know...then why are they so popular with the highborn ladies?

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells's so damn appealin' 'bout gettin' paid a pittance to do the watch's job for 'em? Hmph.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hmm... There must be at least one fair maiden who can tell us something of value...

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text:
WhO nEeDs A gAzEbO?
...i Do.

dialogue.name: OTOMEA02369
dialogue.text: Please, do you think me so foolish to fall for their charade? From what I heard from the others, said “knights” bore not even the slightest resemblance to the Heavens' Ward.

dialogue.name: OTOMEA02369
dialogue.text: As if I had not already memorized every detail of my dear Ser Adelphel's face. Oh, where ever could he be?

dialogue.name: OTOMEB02369
dialogue.text: I am truly outside Her grace! My allowance, all gone to waste on those...those... Ugh, I dare not say it!

dialogue.name: OTOMEB02369
dialogue.text: Mayhap those awful rumors are true. Mayhap...I must needs accept that he now walks in Halone's halls...

dialogue.name: OTOMEC02369
dialogue.text: I demand satisfaction! Swift and terrible vengeance! How dare they prey upon a lady's emotions to line their pockets with gil!

dialogue.name: OTOMEC02369
dialogue.text: If Ser Charibert was here, he'd purge the lot of them like the festering sickness they are!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Ah, yes...a pity he too remains missing. So very much a pity...

dialogue.name: OTOMEA02369
dialogue.text: I shall have some choice words for him when he returns, especially if he cannot properly account for his prolonged absence.

dialogue.name: OTOMEB02369
dialogue.text: He was too beautiful for this world! A good and true knight, a defender of the faith! Oh, Ser Zephirin, I swear I shall never love another...

dialogue.name: OTOMEC02369
dialogue.text: What I'd like to know is who's going to deal with all these criminals and heretics! We can't bloody well be expected to purge them ourselves, now, can we!?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: PaPa HiLdY, pApA hIlDy! ThAt GrAnDmAmA oVeR tHeRe Is StArInG aT uS!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now Gigi, a gentleman must be more careful with his words! First of all, you have only one grandmother! Second─and this is tremendously important─Never, ever call her that. At least...not yet. Promise?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: YeS, fAtHeR! i PrOmIsE nOt To CaLl GrAnDmAmA jUlYaN gRaNdMaMa JuLyAn!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: GrEeTiNgS, m'lAdY!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Ho, ain't you a charmer! And there I was thinkin' I might have to rip yer bloody head off if ye said the G word one more time!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: LiKe ThAt, PaPa HiLdY?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ahhh, my faithful assistants! Have you gleaned any new information?

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Other than the fact that these women scorned seem to detest the fake knights with every fiber of their being?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: These two women were telling me all about what they'd do if they cornered Ser─

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Is this the best ye can do, then? Bloody oaths and girlish fantasies? And ye call yerself a Manderville man!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I assure you, Mother, we are only just getting started! The tapestry of lies and deception behind which the truth hides is oft unraveled with the tug of a single loose thread!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I say, young lady! I would beg but a moment of your time...

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: ...Somehow I doubt that “young lady” was targeted by the charlatans we seek.

dialogue.name: DORYS
dialogue.text: (-Ambitious Crone-)Aye, 'tis true! I too was taken in by the false promises of those awful, awful men!

dialogue.name: DORYS
dialogue.text: (-Ambitious Crone-)Long have I yearned for a chance to meet Ser Vellguine, so when they said I finally could, I didn't hesitate for even a moment! But when they escorted me to the manor and undid the blindfold, and I looked on the hideous faces of those so-called “Grand Sers,” I screamed and fled.

dialogue.name: DORYS
dialogue.text: (-Ambitious Crone-)They were gone when I returned with the watch, but their neighbors said they had overheard them speaking about seeking shelter in a place called Idyllshire. I know it's not much, but I pray this information helps you in your search.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My lady, I swear to you, here and now: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, shall not rest until these dastardly fiends are punished for their foul crimes!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: HuZzAh! ThReE cHeErS fOr PaPa HiLdY! hIp HiP hOoRaY! hIp HiP hOoRaY!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Hip hip hooray...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: And there you have it! Our quarry can be found in Idyllshire. Come, my loyal assistants─justice waits for no gentleman!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: That's all well and good, but I've never heard of this Idyllshire. Have you?

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: You mean, we're to travel to the Dravanian hinterlands? Right now, just like that?

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: So. That was a harrowing journey during which I felt certain I would die horribly, or at least be forced to part ways with my precious bits.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Ooh, can I keep one? I promise I'll walk him and feed him and put fresh herbs in his mask every day!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> Bloody waste of time...

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: ThIs PlAcE fEeLs SoMeHoW fAmIlIaR...bUt I cAn'T pOsSiBlY hAvE cOmE hErE bEfOrE, rIgHt...?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Truly, this magnificent settlement is a testament to the hard work and camaraderie of her uplander and gobbie citizens!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Yes, well, I'm just glad we're no longer being pursued by fire-breathing dragons, musket-wielding crabs, and bomb-throwing goblins. You know, the other ones.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But they were no match for Lady Julyan and that pan of hers, am I right?

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: I wAnT tO sEe HeR mAkE tHe BaD gObBiEs FlY aGaIn!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Godssakes, Hildy! Exceptin' Forename, this lot'd be dead in a ditch somewhere if it weren't for me.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Nonsense! I would never let any harm come to my loyal assistant or my beloved son!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Um, if I may interject...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now then, let us split up and question the good people of Idyllshire. My keen inspector's sense tells me that one of them has knowledge of the false knights we seek!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> ...Could it be?

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: A sorrier lookin' city of vagabonds, cutthroats, and charlatans I've never seen. Don't you fall in with them, hear?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: How blessed these goblins and treasure hunters and adventurers must feel to have the freedom to pursue their dreams and live as they see fit!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: HoOrAy FoR eVeRyThInG!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Ooh, even more nameday gifts for me!

dialogue.name: LOUDJOX
dialogue.text:
Pshhh... Shkohhh...
Yes, yes, Loudjox knows of Grand Sers. Sneaky uplanders keep to selves, mingle not with gobbieflock. But each to own, Loudjox says─no questions, only jinglyshine!

dialogue.name: GEIMLONA
dialogue.text: Oh, you must be talkin' about them “Grand Sers.” They drifted into Idyllshire some time ago, as I recall. Pay visits to the Great Library, though I couldn't tell you why.

dialogue.name: DORYS
dialogue.text: (-Exceedingly Experienced Treasure Hunter-)Oh, I know all about the Grand Sers. They keep to themselves in that building of theirs, south of the Roundspot. You'd best watch out, though─they're a dangerous bunch, liable to kill you for looking at them cockeyed.

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: ...It's entirely possible that I've gone completely and utterly mad, but...are you perchance the long-lost twin sister of an Ishgardian noblewoman?

dialogue.name: DORYS
dialogue.text: (-Exceedingly Experienced Treasure Hunter-)What!? I... Er... Look behind you! A three-headed goobbue!

dialogue.name: CYR
dialogue.text: Why do I feel like I've not seen the last of that old woman...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hmm... If only we had the testimony of a concerned citizen which could conveniently direct us to the villains' precise location.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The Grand Sers are holed up in a building to the south of the markets!? Good show, Forename!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: There, that's the one! Come, let's inform the others!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem that no one is home. There is naught we can do but wait, then.

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: PaPa HiLdY, pApA hIlDy! I jUsT wAnT tO sAy ThAt...ThAt I...rEaLlY lIkE tHiS pLaCe!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: I tHiNk ThAt YoU aNd Me AnD mAmA nAsHu CoUlD hAvE lOtS oF eXcItInG aDvEnTuReS iF wE sTaY hErE...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hmm...you may be right, Gigi. This community seems to have fostered an enlightened, free society, welcoming of honest souls willing to work and contribute to the greater whole. Did anyone happen to see a gazebo on the way in?

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: As I live and shkohhh! Hildibrand Helidor Maximilian Manderville!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Could that be─I say, could that be Slowfix Cointoss!?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Do you know this gobbie, Inspector?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I most certainly do! Why, Master Slowfix was my very first employer!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... When traveling through Thanalan long ago, gobbieflock was waylaid by uplander bandits! With no jinglyshine to pay Brass Blades, we had no way to backtake goods...

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Until we make busydeal with gentleman uplander, that is! With fastness he finds uplander bandits and brings much bangyboom, and returns to goodly gobbies missing goods and great justice!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! Oh, the memories... It was a near thing, for the bandits were clever enough to see through my ingenious disguise as an innocent milkmaid, but in my haste to escape I tripped over a barrel of firesand, and, as they say...boom gobbie doom!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Henceforth Slowfix gains new appreciation for uplanders! But for chance encounter with gentleman uplander, he never conceives of egalitarian utopia. Pshkohhh... One may even claim Hildy a founding father of Idyllshire...with metaphorical tongueflaps, that is.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor! No busydeals for the wicked!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: No “busydeals” indeed...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: But leaving that delightful anecdote aside, ye gods, Master Slowfix! Just looking at what you and your flock have made of these ruins is making me bigeyes!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Gobbieflock has come long way since wandering days, but we have not forgotten gentleman uplander's kindness. Slowfix is here to offer hand-lending!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Well, far be it from me to refuse...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My son Gigi has grown quite fond of your magnificent city, and so I should like to stay here with him and my assistant for a time. We would not require much in the way of accommodations─a humble gazebo, for example, would more than suffice...

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Why settle for gazebo when perfectly good estate right behind you? Residents of building in arrears and Slowfix happy to evict them.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: B-But we were pursuing the fiends who lived here on suspicion of defrauding young women!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Fraud? In Slowfix's egalitarian utopia? This he will not abide! All the more reason to let gentleman uplander and his flock stay instead of Grand Sers─no need for jinglyshine either!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: HuZzAh! A gIaNt GaZeBo To CaLl OuR oWn!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I...I do not know what to say. Thank you, Master Slowfix, thank you!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: No need for teary-eyed tongueflaps! Gobbieflock is possessed of moral obligation to repay gentleman uplander for past generosity. Enjoy new gazebo, and good luck with hunt for Grand Sers!

dialogue.name: GIGI
dialogue.text: Um, PaPa HiLdY...sInCe ThIs Is OuR gAzEbO, iS iT oKaY iF i DrAw OuR fAmIlY cReSt On It?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I can think of no better way to celebrate this joyous occasion─and perhaps draw the ire of our new home's former tenants! Come, let us go and purchase some paints together. This gazebo shall be your canvas!

dialogue.name: JULYAN
dialogue.text: Now he's gone and gotten himself a soddin' gazebo? Bloody hells, if he really thinks I'm goin' to let him keep on playin' at being a father...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Still no sign of the notorious Grand Sers... I daresay we're going to need more paint.
